qas.question: What was the original name of the Science Museum of Oklahoma?

answers.text: Kirkpatrick Science and Air Space Museum at Omniplex

qas.question: When was the International Photography Hall of Fame relocated?

context: The Science Museum Oklahoma (formerly <a0_0>Kirkpatrick Science and Air Space Museum at Omniplex<a0_0/>) houses exhibits on science, aviation, and an IMAX theater. The museum formerly housed the International Photography Hall of Fame (IPHF) that exhibits photographs and artifacts from a large collection of cameras and other artifacts preserving the history of photography. IPHF honors those who have made significant contributions to the art and/or science of photography and relocated to St. Louis, Missouri in <a1_0>2013<a1_0/>.
